snippet: We need to make “debt-ceiling moments” less fraught with peril, less prone to stalemate, and more conducive to productive negotiations.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof David McAdams applies tenets of game theory to political battles over debt ceiling; holds changes must be made so that such moments are less fraught with peril, less prone to stalemate, and more conducive to productive negotiations; contends conservatives should offer to give up brinksmanship over debt ceiling in exchange for fixed target for debt reduction.
lead_paragraph: We need to make “debt-ceiling moments” less fraught with peril, less prone to stalemate, and more conducive to productive negotiations.
